item.title: b.j. upton's walk-off homer beats blue jays
item.description: b.j. upton hit a two-run homer in the ninth inning, giving the tampa bay rays a 3-2 victory over the toronto blue jays on tuesday night.

item.title: south dakota law requires 3-day abortion wait
item.description: south dakota's governor signed into law on tuesday the longest abortion waiting period in the nation at 72 hours, and opponents immediately promised a legal challenge to stop it from going into effect.

item.description: states and local governments are facing their toughest year so far, as rating downgrades continue to outpace upgrades, moody's investors service said on tuesday.

item.description: the resolution, which passed 268 to 145, has no practical effect, but it underscored the anger in congress over being bypassed by the president.

item.title: aussie young guns make statement to thorpe's old guard

item.description: japanese economics minister kaoru yosano said on sunday the government may need to spend 10 trillion yen to 15 trillion yen ($184 billion) for reconstruction from the devastating earthquake that hit the country's northeast in march.

item.description: japanese shares reversed earlier losses to turn positive on thursday, as foreign investors bought battered blue chips and as the yen pulled back from all-time highs.

item.title: legal challenge filed against wisconsin's anti-union law

item.description: syed saleem shehzad had been abducted and received threats from pakistan's intelligence agency.

item.title: dugard kidnapper sentenced to life in prison

item.description: the cuts in compensation and benefits of state employees that texas legislators are considering will affect their own compensation and benefits, too. but not, so far, in their retirement packages.

item.title: u.s. finds tiny amount of radiation in milk
